description: Retrieves a snapshot of the current Region, including whether Amazon Security Lake is enabled for those accounts and which sources Security Lake is collecting data from.

parameters.name: accounts
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID for which a static snapshot of the current Amazon Web Services Region, including enabled accounts and log sources, is retrieved. (string) ---

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Lists if there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Repeat the call using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination token expires after 24 hours. Using an expired pagination token will return an HTTP 400 InvalidToken error.

nested_items.name: dataLakeArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) created by you to provide to the subscriber. For more information about ARNs and how to use them in policies, see the Amazon Security Lake User Guide.

nested_items.name: dataLakeSources
nested_items.description: The list of enabled accounts and enabled sources.

nested_items.name: account
nested_items.description: The ID of the Security Lake account for which logs are collected.

nested_items.name: eventClasses
nested_items.description: The Open Cybersecurity Schema Framework (OCSF) event classes describes the type of data that the custom source will send to Security Lake. For the list of supported event classes, see Supported OCSF Event classes in the Amazon Security Lake User Guide.

nested_items.name: sourceName
nested_items.description: The supported Amazon Web Services services from which logs and events are collected. Amazon Security Lake supports log and event collection for natively supported Amazon Web Services services.

nested_items.name: sourceStatuses
nested_items.description: The log status for the Security Lake account.

nested_items.name: resource
nested_items.description: Defines path the stored logs are available which has information on your systems, applications, and services.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The health status of services, including error codes and patterns.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: Lists if there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Repeat the call using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged.
